div.div: JOHNNY UTAH NOW LEARNING TO SURF THE NET

div.a: Is A Russian Cyber Gang Organizing ‘Mega Heist’ Of U.S. Banks?

div.div: Security firm RSA says that its threat analysts have picked up “underground chatter” indicating that a sophisticated gang of Russian cyber criminals is laying plans to launch an offensive against 30 US banks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QQ8sez&via=Digg&text=Is A Russian Cyber Gang Organizing ‘Mega Heist’ Of U.S. Banks?

div.div: DEBATE DEBATE

div.a: Did Romney Cheat At The Debate?

div.div: No pre-written notes were allowed but a video clip shows Mitt Romney pulling something from his pocket at the start of the first presidential debate.
OVERACHIEVERS
In between exhibiting at the 1939 World’s Fair and collaborating with Charles Eames on a pair of Case Study Houses in 1945, Eero Saarinen did a stint in psy-ops for the U.S. government.
JOBS REPORT TRUTHERS

div.a: If It's Good For Obama, It Can't Be Real

div.div: Good economic news for Obama? Some conservatives insist it can't possibly be true.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R3qNoS&via=Digg&text=If It's Good For Obama, It Can't Be Real

div.div: A HALLOWEEN HORROR STORY

div.a: Be Prepared For A Pumpkin Latte Shortage

div.div: The craze for Pumpkin Spiced Latte has intermittently drained supplies at Starbucks scattered across the country.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OGvdWI&via=Digg&text=Be Prepared For A Pumpkin Latte Shortage

div.div: BROMANCE IS A BEAUTIFUL THING

div.a: Jon Stewart And Bill O'Reilly's Secret Bromance

div.div: The presumed adversaries will face-off at the “Rumble in the Air-Conditioned Auditorium” this weekend. But a survey of their past conversations shows that their relationship is as filled with sexual tension and admiration as it is with antagonistic fire.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SOe34U&via=Digg&text=Jon Stewart And Bill O'Reilly's Secret Bromance

div.div: 140 CHARACTER BRAGS

div.a: If Twitter Bios Told The Truth

div.div: “No one who knows me IRL would use any of these words to describe me, ever.”
SPECIAL K

div.a: How Ketamine Vanquishes Depression Within Hours

div.div: Ketamine works differently than current antidepressants, which can take months to kick in and do not work at all for one out of every three patients.
POLICE LINE: DO NOT CROSS

div.a: LAPD Wants To Keep People Away From Endeavour

div.div: Residents' excitement turns to anger as officials clamp down on security and significantly reduce public access to the shuttle route.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RENUse&via=Digg&text=LAPD Wants To Keep People Away From Endeavour

div.div: MESSING WITH HIS MOAB

div.a: XBox Live Connection Tipped Off Kim Dotcom To Spying

div.div: Kim Dotcom's internet connection was being diverted inside New Zealand weeks before the Government Communications Security Bureau says it started spying on him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SAbF5r&via=Digg&text=XBox Live Connection Tipped Off Kim Dotcom To Spying

div.div: NATURAL BEAUTY

div.a: Fall Foliage To Be Extra Beautiful This Year

div.div: There may be one upside to the United States' dry summer—a brilliant fall leaves season, especially in the Northeast.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ODKFD5&via=Digg&text=Fall Foliage To Be Extra Beautiful This Year

div.div: FAT FINGER SYNDROME

div.a: The Real Reason People Click On Ads On Their Smartphones

div.div: Everyone hates mobile ads so why are we still clicking on them?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WuKI3x&via=Digg&text=The Real Reason People Click On Ads On Their Smartphones

div.div: WINK TWICE FOR THE PLAYBOY CHANNEL

div.a: Three Guys In A Garage Are Turning Your Eyes Into Powerful Remote Controls

div.div: Forget voice controls as the future of TV. Instead, it will be all about your eyes. The technology already exists, and it was built by three young men in a garage. In their spare time.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PEtcop&via=Digg&text=Three Guys In A Garage Are Turning Your Eyes Into Powerful Remote Controls

div.div: HOTEL SAFES ARE NEXT

div.a: Hackers Find A Way To Open Four Million Hotel Doors

div.div: Security expert Matthew Jakubowski, along with two other guys who apparently had nothing better to do, managed to create a device that can infiltrate the bottom of a hotel door lock, thus enabling access. The main tool? A dry-erase marker.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Umq1cT&via=Digg&text=Hackers Find A Way To Open Four Million Hotel Doors

div.div: KILLER CRUSH

div.a: The Horror Of Teen Girls, From Columbiners To Beliebers

div.div: A week after James Holmes shot up an Aurora, Colorado movie theater, the internet was shocked to discover that teenage girls on Tumblr were declaring their love for him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UJ24XO&via=Digg&text=The Horror Of Teen Girls, From Columbiners To Beliebers

div.div: GRAPHIC PACKS
The future of cigarette packs is now on display in Australia, and it’s not pretty.
$60K SCHOOLS

div.a: The Most Expensive Colleges In The U.S.

div.div: At this rate we'll be seeing $130,000-a-year colleges by 2030.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O8UmYG&via=Digg&text=The Most Expensive Colleges In The U.S.

div.div: URBAN PREDATORS

div.a: Wolves, Bears And Mountain Lions May Be Next To Invade Cities

div.div: Scientists are finding that larger carnivores are much more flexible than we gave them credit for and they're adjusting to our cities.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PExcVZ&via=Digg&text=Wolves, Bears And Mountain Lions May Be Next To Invade Cities
